etymons.notes: see Tezel 71; cf. probably Syr. prʕ 1 ‘to uncover; to dishevel’; Arb. Syr. frʕ ‘couper les branches, élaguer, tailler’ Barthelemy 602
etymons.raw: see Tezel 71; cf. probably Syr. prʕ 1 ‘to uncover; to dishevel’; Arb. Syr. frʕ ‘couper les branches, élaguer, tailler’ Barthelemy 602

Infectum.turoyo: Maḥtənne, maḥti maye aʕlayye, maḥtənne bayn am maye. Kfayxi, kfǝrdi (2018_07_01_01.2_Arkah_Ishaq_old_houses_ED: 017) (The burnt limestone crumbles in the water); Kfǝrḏi, kowən čimənto, d əmmina, uʕdo kəmmina čimənto (018)
ko maḥti maye aʕlayye w ko maḥtənne bayn am maye, ko mifardi (Ilyas p.c.)
translations: They put/pour water on them and they put them in water, they crumble.(Ilyas p.c)

Infectum.turoyo: u laḥmo ko mifarad bayn a tlawḥe (Ilyas p.c).
translations: The bread is crumbled in the lentil (soup). (Ilyas p.c)
The wheats were taken out of ears.(Ilyas p.c)
The stones were taken out of the wall.(Ilyas p.c)

Preterit.turoyo: mfardi aʕ ʕǝnwe maṣ suġle [meqǝm ruḥayye].
translations: Grapes were taken out from bunch. (Ilyas p.c)
